file_content.text: You've made Hoth more secure for the Empire. May our enemies tremble!
You're back! I'm sure the scum quotient has been drastically reduced. Bet those pathetic pirates never knew what hit them.
They died like dogs.
At least they can serve entertainment purposes. The important thing is the stolen orders. Thanks to you, we'll know the Republic's plans and movements now.
It was tougher than expected.
Hmm. Maybe I've been underestimating the opposition here. The important thing is the stolen orders. Thanks to you, they've been secured.
Just take the Republic orders and be grateful.
Enough bravado.
Sorry if I offended you, my lord. The important thing is the stolen orders. Thanks to you, we'll know the Republic's plans and movements now.
Yes, sir. The important thing is the stolen orders. Thanks to you, we'll know the Republic's plans and movements now.
Didn't mean to step on your toes, bounty hunter. The important thing is the stolen orders. Thanks to you, they've been secured.
It's a great day for the Empire.
I'll be here to receive the stolen Republic orders you relieve from those idiotic pirates.
Ah, now here comes somebody with some real mettle. Nothing but lowlifes and opportunistic scum on this ice cube.
I'm on the trail of something big. High-level Republic orders up for grabs. Could use some high-powered help to bring them home.
My attention is valuable, Imperial. Better be worth it.
Time is money.
I have a discretionary fund, if that's what you mean. Shouldn't rely on the enlisted for something this important.
I'm on the trail of something big. High-level Republic orders up for grabs. Sith involvement would be much appreciated.
Let's see if you can capture my ambition and rage.
Speak, Captain.
You've attracted my attention, Captain. I hope for your sake you can keep it.
I'm waiting.
Yes, my lord. I hope you'll agree this is too important to rely on my grunts.
I'm on the trail of something big. High-level Republic orders up for grabs. Would appreciate your collaboration.
Keep talking, Captain. You haven't lost my attention yet.
I'm intrigued.
Right. Pretty confident you'll agree--this isn't something we should leave to my grunts.
I'm on the trail of something big. High-level Republic orders up for grabs. Could use someone like you to bring them home.
By "someone like me," you better mean a "lethal killing machine."
That better be a compliment.
To be sure. This is too big to trust to my grunts.
What's the big deal?
Word from Intel is they lay out the enemy's movements, allocations and plans on Hoth. The advantage we would get is considerable.
Is it too much for you?
Look, it's a big opportunity--don't want to trust it to my grunts.
Idiot Republic flew a shuttle too low, even the yahoo pirates couldn't miss. Shot it down, pilfered a lock box with the military orders.
Luckily, pirates can't open the box. Republic shuttle crew has pieces of the cylinder key in their belts. Hoping you can salvage the key then secure the box's contents.
I'll get the orders. And I'll decimate any pirates who get in my way.
Nothing will stop me.
Sounds like the Republic crew is already dead. Too bad--I'll have to destroy extra pirates.
I'll kill many along the way.
I like how you think, my lord.
I'll do it, but I better be paid well.
You'll pay me.
The Empire is generous when pleased with the results.
The Republic orders will go a long way toward defeating our enemy.
For the Empire.
Knew I could count on you.
Makes sense to hit the crash site and salvage the key, then invade the pirate camp for the box.
No promises.
Yeah, alright. If the mood strikes, you can hit the crash site to salvage the keys, then invade the pirate camp for the lock box.
Feel free to waste as many pirate scum as you like along the way. I'll be here waiting to relay the Republic orders to High Command.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
Hmph. Fine. Change your mind, come see me.
Our enemies on this planet are pathetic. I predict absolute victory here.
